title: Preserving the information in historic artefacts: condition monotoring and colletions mangement
abstractText: Our textile heritage represents a unique and irriplaceable resource, a vital element of our material legacy, evidencing international trade, social history, agricultural development, artistic trends, and technological progress amongst the yarns. Concerns over the well being of such heritage are recognised nationally and internationally. There is a demand in museums and historic houses for collections management tools which will help inform curatorial and conservation strategy. The proposed research will assess the approach to on-site condition monitoring of textile artefacts towards ensuring their long-term preservation, taking linen, which composes the canvas of embrioderies, rugs, sails and upholstery, as an exemplar.
